I am an assistant professor in the [Department of Mathematical Sciences](https://www.kent.edu/math) at [Kent State University](https://www.kent.edu). I have a diverse academic background with a PhD in Electrical Engineering from Virginia Tech, and postdoctoral training in translational research at The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center and statistical proteomics at Northeastern University. During my doctoral studies, I worked as a graduate research assistant at the Georgetown Lombardi Comprehensive Cancer Center. My current research is focused on the development of statistical and computational methods for applications in bioinformatics.
